page.title: 08DARTMOOR LETTERBOXES
page.content: WHEN TALKING OF LETTERBOXES ON DARTMOOR WE CONJURE UP A FALSE PICTURE OF A RED CAST-IRON BOX, WHERE YOU MAY POST A LETTER. FAR FROM THIS URBAN IDEA, THE FIRST DARTMOOR LETTERBOX WAS MERELY A BOTTLE STUCK IN A BANK AT CRANMERE POOL IN 1854. A MODERN LETTERBOX MAY BE AN ICECREAM CONTAINER WITH AN INK PAD, A RUBBER STAMP AND A VISITORS BOOK.SOME OF THE STAMPS ARE SHOWN IN ONE OF THE PICTURES FOR THIS AREA.THE AIM OF THE LETTERBOX HUNTER IS TO COLLECT ENOUGH STAMPS TO BECOME A MEMBER OF THE '100 CLUB' BY VISITING 100 OR MORE BOXES. SOME HUNTERS HAVE THIER OWN STAMPS WITH WHICH TO "SIGN" THE VISITORS BOOK AT THE LETTERBOX. THE STAMPS ARE HIDDEN ALL OVER THE MOOR, CLUES BEING AVAILABLE TO HELP FIND THEM. THERE ARE OVER 750 ON THE MOOR AT ANY TIME. MARK NORRISH (WOODSMOKE WANDERERS)
